contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Naokawa'''|直川村|Naokawa-son}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Minamiamabe District, Ōita|Minamiamabe District]], [[Ōita Prefecture|Ōita]], [[Japan]]. On March 3, 2005 Naokawa, along with the towns of [[Kamae, Ōita|Kamae]], [[Kamiura, Ōita|Kamiura]], [[Tsurumi, Ōita|Tsurumi]], [[Ume, Ōita|Ume]] and [[Yayoi, Ōita|Yayoi]], and the villages of [[Honjō, Ōita|Honjō]] and [[Yonōzu, Ōita|Yonōzu]], all from [[Minamiamabe District, Ōita|Minamiamabe District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Saiki, Ōita|Saiki]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,765 and the [[population density|density]] of 34.21 persons per km². The total area was 80.82 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Naokawa, Oita}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ōita Prefecture]] {{Oita-geo-stub}}
